intro: Acmella psilocarpa, commonly known as the golden cress or false piper, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It has a short life cycle, blooming and setting seed within a few months. Despite its modest appearance, it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
